Class QuineMcCluskey

java.lang.Object
QuineMcCluskey
public class QuineMcCluskey extends Object
The QuineMcCluskey class provides all fields and methods necessary for solving the simplification of Boolean functions using the Quine-McCluskey Tabular Method.
Since:
2023-11-21
Version:
1.0
Author:
Marxel S. Abogado, Carla Joy G. Haboc

  • Method Details

    • convertString

      private int[] convertString(String s)
      converts the minterms String input and checks if valid
      Parameters:
      s - a valid String containing the minterms to be solved
      Returns:
      int array with minterms parsed from String input

    • group

      private ArrayList<Term>[] group(Term[] terms)
      groups an array of terms based on their number of ones
      Parameters:
      terms - array of terms to be grouped
      Returns:
      array of array lists of terms where each element represents a group of terms with the same number of ones

    • solve

      public void solve()
      first stage of solution using Quine-McCluskey method main solver method of the class to be called

    • solveSecond

      public void solveSecond()
      second stage of solution using Quine-McCluskey method recursively calls itself if there are still remaining minterms

    • checkRepeats

      boolean checkRepeats(int[] m)
      check if there are repeated elements in the minterms int array
      Parameters:
      m - the int array of minterms
      Returns:
      true if no duplicates, else false

    • checkValidity

      boolean checkValidity(Term term1, Term term2)
      check if two terms are valid for grouping
      Parameters:
      term1 - the first term to be checked
      term2 - the second term to be checked
      Returns:
      true if grouping is possible, else false if not

    • contains

      boolean contains(Term term1, Term term2)
      check if two terms have all its numbers present in another term
      Parameters:
      term1 - the first term to be the basis of checking
      term2 - the second term to checked for presence of numbers in term1
      Returns:
      true if term1 contains all its numbers present in term2, else false

    • simplify

      void simplify()
      simplifies the solution done on the object using Petrick's method

    • multiply

      HashSet<String> multiply(HashSet<String>[] p, int k)
      multiplies elements from sets at indeces adjacent to each other in the Hash set array and recurvisely computes for the product
      Parameters:
      p - an array of Hash sets containing elements to be multiplied
      k - the index pointing to the first set to be multiplied
      Returns:
      a Hash set resulting from the multiplcation of adjacent sets in a Hash set array

    • mix

      String mix(String str1, String str2)
      mixes terms and simplifies those that are duplicated with respect to properties of boolean expressions
      Parameters:
      str1 - the first string to be multiplied
      str2 - the second string to be multiplied
      Returns:
      a string containing the simplified boolean product of both input strings

    • identifyPrimeImplicants

      private boolean identifyPrimeImplicants()
      identify prime implicants, add them to primeImplicants array list, and remove from minterms and finalTerms array lists
      Returns:
      true if prime implicants are identified, else false

    • columnDominance

      private boolean columnDominance()
      identify dominating columns and removes them from the minterms and finalTerms array lists
      Returns:
      true if there are dominating columns and were identified and removed, else false

    • rowDominance

      private boolean rowDominance()
      identify dominating rows and removes them from the minterms and finalTerms array lists
      Returns:
      true if there are dominating rows and were identified and removed, else false

      Returns:

      Parameters:

      Returns:
